stories.text:
This might be out of the typical conversation here on HN, but I find a lot of the commenters here typically have insightful & well researched answers.

My wife and I began our journey roughly a 10 months ago and was looking for ways I could help booster the odds from my side. I've looked into a Maca Root supplement, has anyone tried it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Anyone use supplements to help conceive?
Intel Is Gearing Up to Give a 'Superpower' to Linux
Proton Pump Inhibitors Increase the Risk of Autoimmune Diseases

stories.text:
I need to get some concepts cleared because it looks to be something I could use right away for a project of mine. Bears mentioning that I come from the AWS world so I’m trying to get DOs from that perspective.

1. Is a durable object just a singleton JavaScript object which can write to a file?

2. Say I have a config JSON. Can a DO be used to update that json without worrying about one updater overwriting someone else’s updates? Basically, do DOs guarantee updates?

3. Is a DO in any way related to databases like DynamoDB or object stores like S3? I don’t think it is but if it is, how so?

4. Is a Cloudflare worker the same as a Lambda@Edge? So a DO is just a backend for (essentially) a bunch of Lambda@Edge functions?

Any help would be very appreciated? I’ve read the CF docs but they don’t give a conceptual overview of the product
stories.title: Ask HN: Anyone here using Cloudflare’s durable objects?
CDC: 61% of Teenagers Hospitalized for Covid-19 Had Obesity
You’re a Dictatorship That Gathers Individual Democracies–Good for You
